title: Andy Murray marks fairytale comeback by claiming first singles title since hip surgery
text:
Andy Murray powered his way to an emotional victory as he claimed the European Open title just nine months after his career seemed to be over.

The 32 year-old Scot defeated fellow former Grand Slam winner Stan Wawrinka 3-6 6-4 6-4 in two hours and 26 minutes.

It seemed Murray was down and out when he faced two break points at 1-3 in the second set. He was also twice down a break in the decider but his cussedness and skill saw him through what was a high quality encounter.

Andy Murray lifts the European Open trophy aloft after beating Stan Wawrinka on Sunday

Murray was in tears after marking his fairytale comeback from hip surgery in Antwerp

Murray hides the tears pouring down his face after claiming his first title since hip surgery

The Swiss star puts on a brave face as he picks up his runner-up trophy in Belgium

Murray overcame Wawrinka in three sets, winning 3-6 6-4 6-4 in two hours and 26 minutes

'After all that's happened it is one of my biggest wins,' said an almost disbelieving Murray, who had a Major hip operation in late January.

This will see his ranking head into the world's top 130 although in reality he is already back in top twenty shape.

More to follow...

Wawrinka claimed the early advantage but the Scot bounced back in emphatic fashion
description: MIKE DICKSON IN ANTWERP: Andy Murray powered his way to an emotional victory as he claimed the European Open title just nine months after his career seemed to be over.
